Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Patient ID: [REDACTED]
Date of procedure: [REDACTED]
Attending physician: Dr. N. Patel
Assistants: Pulmonary fellow; radiology technologist; circulating nurse.

Pre-procedure diagnosis: 24 mm solid right lower lobe superior segment nodule in a patient with prior stereotactic body radiotherapy to the left lower lobe; PET-avid without nodal disease.
Post-procedure diagnosis: Same.
Indication: Local treatment of presumed primary lung cancer in a medically inoperable patient.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.0 mm endotracheal tube; ASA class III.

Procedures performed:
1. Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy (Illumisite platform) with cone-beam CT guidance.
2. Transbronchial microwave ablation of right lower lobe superior segment nodule using Emprint catheter.

Procedure description: After endotracheal intubation, the navigation bronchoscope was advanced to the right lower lobe. The Illumisite system was used to register the pre-procedural CT and plan a pathway to the superior segment lesion. Initial navigation demonstrated CT-to-body divergence; a tomosynthesis acquisition was performed and the nodule position was updated. A CrossCountry needle was advanced into the lesion, and the extended working channel was positioned 1 cm beyond the nodule center. Two sequential ablations (10 minutes and 7 minutes) were performed with slight retraction of the catheter between ablations to elongate the ablation zone. Cone-beam CT confirmed an elongated ablation zone encompassing the 2.4 cm lesion with an approximate minimal margin of 5 to 6 mm. A small right apical pneumothorax was seen on the post-ablation scan, without hemodynamic compromise.

Estimated blood loss: <10 mL.
Complications: Small asymptomatic right pneumothorax managed conservatively with supplemental oxygen and observation; no chest tube required.
Disposition: Extubated in the operating room, monitored overnight with serial chest radiographs; discharged home on post-procedure day 1 with follow-up CT in 6 to 8 weeks.
